page.title: 02Farming in South Clifton
page.content: As one might expect,one of the main occupations of the block is farming.There eight farmers within the grid who are mostly involved with mixed farming.Cattle are mostly reared for beef and include such breeds as Hereford X,Charolais X,and Murray Blue.Sheep include Suffolk and Mules.One farmer concentrates solely on sheep.Crops grown include sugar beet,barley,wheat,potatoes,carrots and oil seed rape.The farmers all attend Newark Cattle Market which is held on a Wednesday,for the buying and selling of cattle.Sheep are sent futher afield to Berwick on Tweed,Yorkshire and Derbyshire.All the farmers work at least ten hours a day but manage to have time off at the weekend.Apart from one they all have an annual holiday in late May or early between the sowing and harvesting seasons.
